thread.title: Tin Roof’s Rouragou, named after creature of Cajun folklore, returns in late October for limited time
thread.title_full: Tin Roof’s Rouragou, named after creature of Cajun folklore, returns in late October for limited time

title: Tin Roof’s Rouragou, named after creature of Cajun folklore, returns in late October for limited time
text:
Oct 12, 2015 14:48 Tin Roof’s Rouragou, named after creature of Cajun folklore, returns in late October for limited time Tin Roof’s Rouragou, named after creature of Cajun folklore, returns in late October for limited time Photo provided by Tin Roof Brewing Company -- Tin Roof's fall single batch imperial black ale, Rougarou, returns in late October. BY MATTHEW SIGUR | Comments 
Baton Rouge’s brewery Tin Roof will release its single batch imperial black ale, Rougarou , later this month. 
According to a press release, the beer will be available for a limited time in limited quantities around Louisiana and Mississippi, starting the last week of October. The beer will be available in 22-ounce bomber bottles. 
The dark beer is named after the bayou-wandering creature of Cajun folklore. 
Tin Roof co-founder Charles Caldwell said the beer has characteristics of a darker beer and the intense hops and aroma of a Double IPA. 
Follow Matthew Sigur on Twitter @MatthewSigur . Get The Advocate in your inbox
